titles.title: Protecting Resort Cities from Discrimination Act of 2009

To prohibit an agency or department of the United States from establishing or implementing an internal policy that discourages or prohibits the selection of a resort or vacation destination as the location for a conference or event, and for other purposes.
Protecting Resort Cities from Discrimination Act of 2009

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Government Management, Organization, and Procurement.

committee.name: House Oversight and Accountability
committee.subcommittee: Government Operations and the Federal Workforce

bill.summary: Protecting Resort Cities from Discrimination Act of 2009 - Prohibits a federal agency from establishing or implementing an internal policy that discourages or prohibits the selection of a travel, event, meeting, or conference location because it is perceived to be a resort or vacation destination.
